text: Just saw a LinkedIn coach with 'I help you grow' in their bio... with 300 followers. Maybe they should help themselves first?
Job applications today: 1. Upload resume. 2. Manually fill the same details. 3. Answer unnecessary questions. 4. Never hear back. The real endurance test!
Reminder: Your job title does not define your worth. Your skills, resilience, and character do. Keep pushing!
LinkedIn motivation be like: 'I woke up at 4 AM, ran 10 miles, built a startup, closed 3 deals, and still had time to meditate. No excuses!'
Interviews that go like: 'Where do you see yourself in 5 years?' Me: 'Hopefully not still answering this question.'
Sending 50 applications per day won’t guarantee a job, but improving your skills, networking, and persistence will. Work smart, not just hard!
If you’re struggling with job rejections, remember: The company that rejected you today might not even exist in 5 years. Keep going!
LinkedIn flex posts be like: 'I turned down a $500K offer because I value work-life balance.' Bro, I just want a reply from HR!
You don’t need a fancy title or a top company’s name to prove your worth. Your skills and dedication speak louder than any brand!
Ghosting candidates after multiple interview rounds should be illegal. Respect people’s time!
People who give unpaid internship offers be like: 'We offer great exposure.' Yes, exposure to financial struggles!
If your work makes you miserable every single day, it’s time to rethink your career path. You deserve better!
Every LinkedIn success story starts with: 'I had only $5 in my pocket...' Bro, I still have $5. Where’s my success?
Rejection doesn’t mean you’re not good enough. It means that opportunity wasn’t meant for you. The right one will come!
'We’re like a family here' = We expect you to work overtime for free.
